com.google.appengine.tools.mapreduce.impl.shardedjob

Interface ShardedJobService


  • public interface ShardedJobService
    Allows interaction with sharded jobs.
    Author:
    ohler@google.com (Christian Ohler)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void abortJob(String jobId)
      Aborts execution of the job with the given ID.

      Deletes all data of a completed job with the given ID.

      <T extends IncrementalTask> 
      void      		 startJob(String jobId, List<? extends T> initialTasks, ShardedJobController<T> controller, ShardedJobSettings settings)

    • Method Detail

      • startJob

        <T extends IncrementalTask> void startJob(String jobId,
                                        List<? extends T> initialTasks,
                                        ShardedJobController<T> controller,
                                        ShardedJobSettings settings)
        Starts a new sharded job with the given ID and parameters. The ID must be unique. This method is idempotent -- if another invocation of this method aborted (or is in an unknown state, possibly still running or completed), starting the job can be retried by calling the method again with the same arguments. The job won't start twice unless cleanupJob(java.lang.String) is called in between.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of tasks that the job consists of

      • getJobState

        ShardedJobState getJobState(String jobId)
        Returns the state of the job with the given ID. Returns null if no such job exists.

      • lookupTasks

        Iterator<IncrementalTaskState<IncrementalTask>> lookupTasks(ShardedJobState state)
        Returns the tasks associated with this ShardedJob.

      • abortJob

        void abortJob(String jobId)
        Aborts execution of the job with the given ID. If the job has already finished or does not exist, this is a no-op.

      • cleanupJob

        boolean cleanupJob(String jobId)
        Deletes all data of a completed job with the given ID. Data is being deleted asynchronously. Returns true if job was already deleted or asynchronous task was submitted successfully.
